title: I generally view my email folders in a 'Unified Folders' list but one of my main folders has appeared within another folder
creator: steve293
content: I've attached a screen shot of the main folders seen when I view these as 'Unified Folders' with folders names starting with *01, *02, *03 etc. Somehow, *04 is no longer appearing in this list and has instead appeared inside the *03 folder as seen in my second screen shot. I don't know how this folder and the many sub-folders it contains was moved into the *03 folder and no matter what I do, I can't move the *04 folder out of the *03 folder to sit where it should between folders *03 and *04. Can anyone point me in the right direction to move the *04 folder into the desired location? Thanks in advance, SteveJ

title: Suddenly, yesterday, my email stopped allowing me to send emails.
creator: mpaxton
content:
My email set-up is a mess. In December, when I had a problem, my provider told me to open a new account, which I did. Both my old and new accounts received emails for a few days, and then only the new account was receiving emails. Now I find that my drafts and sent messages are saved to the old account, and suddenly yesterday I was unable to send emails, from either account.

I keep getting this error message: "Sending of the message failed. Peer reports incompatible or unsupported protocol version.: The configuration related to mail.activ8.net.au must be corrected"

I have no idea what this means or how to correct it.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/144.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;os:Windows 11

title: Kopieren meiner Filter-Einstellungen von "Lokale Ordner" zum IMAP-Konto
creator: minsk132
content: Hallo, ich habe meine E-Mail-Konten in Thunderbird umgestellt von POP zu IMAP. Meine Filter-Einstellungen waren bisher gültig für "Lokale Ordner" (die Filter musste ich manuell starten) Wie kann ich die Filter-Einstellungen auf den Posteingang meiner IMAP-Konten kopieren/migrieren? Danke, und Grüße aus Berlin
